meanings.definition: A person who habitually borrows or lives off others without any intention of repaying.
meanings.sent1: The schnorrer always asked for money but never paid it back.
meanings.sent2: The community knew him as the local schnorrer who never returned what he borrowed.
meanings.sent3: The schnorrer tried to borrow from the same person twice in one day!
meanings.sent4: He was a schnorrer, sucking the generosity out of everyone around him.
meanings.sent5: The schnorrer's face was unforgettable, always asking for handouts.

meanings.definition: To beg or mooch off others for food or money.
meanings.sent1: She would schnorrer food from her classmates during lunch.
meanings.sent2: He decided to schnorrer some change from his friends for the bus fare.
meanings.sent3: The dog seemed to schnorrer for treats whenever someone was eating.
meanings.sent4: The politician would schnorrer votes from the unsuspecting public.
meanings.sent5: The street performer would schnorrer attention with his loud music.
